intro: Hieracium melastomoides, commonly known as the false hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium melastomoides is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting pollinators.
